title: Help identifying this font off a t-shirt
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019095840im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo%20font_4371.jpg)

Hi all, my dad wanted me to whip up a logo design using this font for his sales team. I think I've identified it as Black-Block Norm, but I wanted to check if there's anything closer. Also, if it's more similar to a font that may already be loaded in word/photoshop, or can be downloaded for free?

Thanks so much everyone!
author: prestond

comments.content:
This one looks close, but it's not an exact match:  
 **[SF Hollywood Hills](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019095840/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Dafont-2&ffam=SF%20Hollywood%20Hills%20Extended%20-%20Regular&fid=5936ab92f0278fb4e3f1b3f76225b279&fsize=60&text=RED%20DRAGON&fit=1)** by ShyFonts (1999, free for Personal use)  
Your sample image is too deformed for an exact id.

------------------  
I found it using "Find my Font": [http://www.findmyfont.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019095840/http:/www.findmyfont.com/ "http://www.findmyfont.com")
SF Hollywood Hills looks like a squooshed [ITC Machine](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019095840/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/machine/) to me.
Not exactly squooshed, the following letters look different /E/F/M/Q/Z but you are right that it smells like a copy or at least like they share a common origin.
